question: Which of the following was the immediate cause of attack on Calcutta in 1756 by Nawab Siraj-ud-Daula?
option1: Refusal of the English Company to pay the overdue trade tax.
option2: The English conspired against the Nawab with a view to depose him from the Throne.
option3: Siraj-ud-Daula wanted to drive out the English from Bengal.
option4: Refusal of the English to demolish the fortification of Calcutta.
answer: Refusal of the English to demolish the fortification of Calcutta.
explanation: The immediate cause of attack on Calcutta in 1756 by Nawab Siraj-ud-Daula was the refusal of the English to demolish the fortification of Calcutta. Other reasons were that the English strengthened the fortification around the Fort William without any intimation and approval and they grossly abused the trade privileges granted to them by the Mughal rulers.
